question: What is YESCARTA?
ideal_answer: Yescarta is an autologous chimeric antigen receptor (CAR) T cell therapy approved by the FDA. Yescarta™ is approved for the treatment of adult patients with R/R large B cell lymphoma. It is a CD19-specific CAR T cell therapy lysing CD19-positive targets.

snippets.text: Two autologous chimeric antigen receptor (CAR) T cell therapies (Kymriah™ and Yescarta™) were recently approved by the FDA. Kymriah™ is for the treatment of pediatric patients and young adults with refractory or relapse (R/R) B cell precursor acute lymphoblastic leukemia and Yescarta™ is for the treatment of adult patients with R/R large B cell lymphoma. In common, both are CD19-specific CAR T cell therapies lysing CD19-positive targets.
